topics.title: Basic Arithmetic Operations

topics.title: Exponents and Percentages

topics.title: Basic Fraction Operations
topics.theory: Basic fraction operations include addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of fractions. These operations require understanding how to find a common denominator for addition and subtraction, as well as applying rules for multiplying and dividing numerators and denominators. Mastery of fractions is crucial in mathematical problem-solving, measurements, and real-world applications.

Converting fractions may include changing improper fractions to mixed numbers, converting between decimals and fractions, or simplifying fractions. These concepts are essential for accurately handling fractional values in mathematical operations, problem-solving, and real-world contexts.

topics.title: Arithmetic Sequences
topics.theory: An arithmetic sequence is a sequence of numbers in which the difference between consecutive terms is constant. This difference is called the common difference. Arithmetic sequences are commonly used to model linear patterns in mathematics, and they have applications in areas such as finance, engineering, and everyday problem-solving.

types_of_problems.type: Find the n-th term of an arithmetic sequence

problems.tip: To find the term at position ${n} of an arithmetic sequence, use the general formula: aₙ = a₁ + (n - 1) * d.
step_by_step_solution: Step 1: Note that the general formula for the term at position ${n} is aₙ = a₁ + (n - 1) * d.
Step 2: Substitute the value of a₁ into the formula: aₙ = ${a1} + (n - 1) * ${d}.
Step 3: Substitute the value of n into the formula: aₙ = ${a1} + (${n} - 1) * ${d}.
Step 4: Perform the multiplication: (${n} - 1) * ${d} = #{(n - 1) * d}.
Step 5: Add ${a1} to the result of the multiplication.
Step 6: The result is #{a1 + (n - 1) * d}.

Step 4: Subtract 2 * ${a1} from both sides of the equation, obtaining #{2 * sum / m - 2 * a1} = (m - 1)d.
Step 5: Divide the result from Step 4 by (m - 1) to isolate d.
Step 6: The common difference d is #{(2 * sum / m - 2 * a1) / (m - 1)}.
